intro: Pachycentria constricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open plains. Pachycentria constricta is a member of the Apocynaceae family, known for its milky sap and ecological importance to certain pollinators.
